folder: Wythe Ave. & 5th St. S., Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1)
Wythe Ave., east side, north from South 5th Street. This view from the Williamsburg Bridge, shows in the foreground, parallel with the bridge, a group of frame houses that are to be demolished.
October 19, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
Neg. #2101 & Neg. #2757
(2)
The same, showing some of the frame houses facing the bridge demolished. Left standing are Nos. 71 and 75; at the right foreground is the American Schaefer and Budenberg Corp. Building. In the background at the right is David Weil Lithographic Co.Building. In the center of the view is seen P.S. No. 37, depicting an old type of school architecture.
September 1, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

59-73 South 5th Street, north side, from and including Wythe Ave., to but not including Berry Street. Also seen is 365-373 Wythe Ave., east side, at, adjoining and north of South 5th Street. The buildings shown are frame.

April 11, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
